property.name: text
property.value:
This model illustrates the use of a domain-specific ontology to ensure correct composition of components. In particular, this ontology that a fuel level is not misinterpreted as a fuel flow, and vice versa.
Above are three annotations on the model that provide the initial constraints. A solver infers from these constraints whether signals are levels, flows, or neither, throughout the model. The results of the infererence are shown as annotations on the ports (and also as color-coded highlights). To see the ontology definition, look inside the solver.

property.name: text
property.value: [see Leung, Mandl, Lee, Latronico, Shelton, Tripakis, & Lickly, "Scalable Semantic Annotation using Lattice-based Ontologies," MODELS 2009.]

property.name: text
property.value: Right click on the solver and Open Actor to see the ontology definition and the default actor constraints.
